comments:
Driver:  1004I

When creating a Java skeleton from WSDL file, hitting Next to go to Page 3 
resulted in the error:

IWAB0234E An internal error occurred. Details: null
    java.lang.NullPointerException
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.common.J2EEUtils.getProjectsContainingComponentOfTyp
e(J2EEUtils.java:401)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.runtime.ClientRuntimeSelectio
nWidgetDefaultingCommand.getProjectChoice
(ClientRuntimeSelectionWidgetDefaultingCommand.java:273)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.runtime.ClientRuntimeSelectio
nWidgetDefaultingCommand.getClientTypesChoice
(ClientRuntimeSelectionWidgetDefaultingCommand.java:256)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.runtime.ClientRuntimeSelectio
nWidgetDefaultingCommand.execute
(ClientRuntimeSelectionWidgetDefaultingCommand.java:180)
    at

dgetDefaultingCommand.execute
(ServerRuntimeSelectionWidgetDefaultingCommand.java:75)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runComm
and(CommandFragmentEngine.java:347)
Same problem in Web Services Client wizard.

Testing with the 1004I driver, with a new workspace with no servers, I am able 
to go through the Web service scenario (bottom-up or client).  However, once I 
created a server in the workspace, then ComponentCore.createComponent returns 
the "servers" component as one of the component in the workspace and 
IVirutualComponent.getComponentTypeId() on that "servers" component returns 
null.  If the "servers" component is not in the workspace, the proper 
componentType is returned (i.e. they are not null but set to "jst.web").  You 
can easily reproduce the problem by just creating a server in the workspace and 
then go through bottom-up or client Web service scenario.
The problems existed in the J2EEUtils class.....
